items.title: Wellness and Preventive Care
items.desc: We provide routine veterinary care for pets such as vaccination for preventable diseases, deworming for gastrointestinal parasites. Nutritional requirement of pets vary with breed, age and medical condition of dog or cat, for detailed information, please consult with our veterinarians.

items.title: Health or Clinical Examination
items.desc: Our veterinarians perform regular Health examination on pets (Dog, Cat and Exotics) and observe for signs of different medical condition. Health examination starts with medical history, followed by complete physical examination. During this process our staff Veterinarians may offer different diagnostics options to arrive at a definitive diagnosis.

items.title: National and International Health Certificates
items.desc: All pets traveling need a current exam for health and vaccine status. Regulations vary for different travel situations. Please check with the consulate of the country to which you are traveling to ensure all paperwork is complete.

items.title: Vaccinations
items.desc: Vaccines are given at annual appointments. Canine vaccines include:- Rabies vaccine, DA2PP (Distemper, Parvovirus, Adenovirus (Hepatitis) and Parainfluenza vaccine, Bordetella (Kennel Cough) vaccine, Leptosporosis and Lyme disease vaccine. Feline vaccines include:- Rabies vaccine, FVRCP (Panleukopenia or feline distemper, rhinotracheitis and calicivirus) vaccine and Leukemia vaccine.

items.title: Spay and Neuter
items.desc: Dogs and cats should be sterilized to avoid unwanted pregnancies and some abnormal behaviors. In addition to unwanted pregnancies, Spaying females reduces or eliminate several uterine conditions (Pyometra, Metritis and Ovarian cysts) and Mammary gland tumors. Neutering males reduces Prostitis, Paraphimosis and some abnormal behaviors. Ideal age for spay and neuter for dogs and cats is 6 months.

items.title: Dentistry
items.desc: Dogs and cats needs regular dental care to remove tartar and plaque to prevent pets loosing their teeth and remove bad breath. During routine visit at our hospital our veterinarians advise about routine dental hygiene of pets.

items.title: Radiology
items.desc: We are very happy to introduce state of art digital radiology machine at out Hospital, this equipment is used to diagnose and visualize within the animal body.

items.title: Diagnostics and Treatments
items.desc: We provide comprehensive diagnostics blood work, urine analysis, fecal analysis and much more to diagnose different medical conditions and treatments are provided accordingly.

items.title: Grooming, Day Boarding
items.desc: Our technician/assistants offer nail trimming, lionshaves and day boarding to our clients

items.title: Online Store
items.desc: Our online store is live at https://taylorvetclinic.clientvantage.ca/. Clients can now browse through thousands of pet products and order from the comfort of your own home. Products can be picked up here at the clinic or shipped directly to you. Food, supplements, treats, toys and accessories can all be ordered online. Also, a HUGE selection of large animal (equine) and exotics (Rabbits, hamsters, reptiles, and birds!) Available to you at the click of a button! If you've been in lately and haven't seen what you're looking for, we bet you can find it on here! Give us a call if you have any question regarding this helpful new tool!
